evidence.source_document: Order Granting Temporary Restraining Order and Compelling Certain Discovery Production (001)
evidence.text: The Court GRANTS a temporary restraining order as described below. The Court finds it appropriate to highlight several of these declarations to illustrate what is at stake in this lawsuit and some of the ways in which executive and legislative powers intersect.

evidence.source_document: Order Granting Temporary Restraining Order and Compelling Certain Discovery Production (001)
evidence.text: This Court should stay the district court’s order of May 9, 2025, granting respondents’ motion for a TRO against the Executive Order and Memo and requiring disclosure of privileged RIF-related documents.

extracted.value: Court granted temporary restraining order against Executive Order 14210 and OMB/OPM Memorandum, requiring disclosure of privileged RIF-related documents to be stayed pending appeal.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Plaintiffs filed their complaint on Monday, April 28, 2025 (Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief, Page 16). The case is pending with a temporary restraining order in effect (Order Granting Temporary Restraining Order and Compelling Certain Discovery Production (001), Page 10), and no settlement has been reached or mentioned.

evidence.source_document: Order Granting Temporary Restraining Order and Compelling Certain Discovery Production (001)
evidence.text: No formal decree has been entered (Order Granting Temporary Restraining Order and Compelling Certain Discovery Production (001), Page 10). The case is pending with a temporary restraining order, so decree dates cannot be determined.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: No settlement exists (Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief, Page 16; Order Granting Temporary Restraining Order and Compelling Certain Discovery Production (001), Page 10). Disputes over settlement enforcement are not applicable as no settlement has been reached.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Plaintiffs contend that the executive branch cannot lawfully implement large-scale reductions in the federal workforce without the participation of Congress. They bring this suit against President Trump, numerous federal agencies, and their respective agency heads. Specifically, plaintiffs contest several layers of actions within the executive branch. First, they argue President Trump exceeded his authority when issuing Executive Order 14210... Second, they argue that a subsequent memo from OMB and OPM implementing the executive order exceeded those agencies' authority and violated the APA.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs allege Executive Order 14210 and OMB/OPM Memorandum directing agencies to implement large-scale RIFs, eliminate non-statutory functions (including DEI initiatives), and reduce workforce by 8-50% without congressional approval, violating separation of powers and APA.

evidence.source_document: Order Granting Temporary Restraining Order and Compelling Certain Discovery Production (001)
evidence.text: To the extent that the likelihood of certiorari bears on applicants’ entitlement to a stay pending mandamus, that factor supports relief as well. This Court has previously granted certiorari to consider the government’s entitlement to mandamus relief from discovery orders infringing on executive-branch confidentiality interests.

extracted.value: Prohibits disclosure of privileged RIF-related documents to unions; requires agencies to continue operations without implementing RIFs pending resolution of case.
